entry.content:

Tests for webrtc showed that it improves encoding perf and there is no reason to think that it will be different for webcodecs.

entry.title: Add TabPageDecorator and use it in PageTimelineMonitor
entry.content:
This CL introduces TabPageDecorator, which attaches TabHandles to

PageNodes that are tabs. These TabHandles remain constant across tab

discards, even though the PageNode they refer to changes. This is

useful for PM elements interested in tracking PageNodes associated with

tabs, eliminating the need for these elements to implement their own

tab <-> PageNode mappings, which can be error prone.

entry.title: [color] Address hover contrast issues for window accent frames
entry.content:
Currently the hover color for frame elements is set by GM3

definitions. This occurs even in the case where windows forces

the window frame to its accent color.



This CL updates the hover color definitions when the frame override

colors are set to match the behavior of GM3 to avoid mixing colors

from different design systems on the same surface.

entry.title: avif_image_decoder: Use libavif's yuv to rgb function
entry.content:
Get rid of the pixel by pixel loop in the wrapper and use

libavif's conversion function instead. It uses libyuv if the

image's color configuration supports it, otherwise has built-in C

code which is slightly faster in some cases. It also has support

for multi-threaded conversion which is better.



The PaintCanvasVideoRenderer (PCVR) path is still retained and

will be used if the image's color configuration supports it.



Also relax the pixel error tolerance from 1 to 2 for two 12-bit

YUVA test images because libavif uses libyuv for those files.

libyuv's fixed-point arithmetic is less accurate than

gfx::ColorTransform's floating-point arithmetic (similar to

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3546131)



Performance is mostly neutral with some files being ~50% faster.



Binary size increase is due to a few new libavif functions being

accessed. Worth the performance/code re-use benefits.



Change-Id: Ib61bc7a8905b986c946f97e4791f02d81d1af3fe

Binary-Size: See reasoning above.

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4698835

Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

Reviewed-by: Wan-Teh Chang

Commit-Queue: Vignesh Venkat

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1181018}

entry.title: [iOS] Sign-out user when history sync declined after dedicated sign-in
entry.content:
When user uses a promo dedicated to History Sync:



- Sign-in is required if the user is in signed-out state. In this case,

if the user declines eventually History Sync, a sign-out must to be

done, given they'll not get any benefit out of sign-in.

- If the user is already signed-in and have not selected their account

manually just before enabling History Sync, the disclaimer footer

of the History Sync Opt-In screen should indicates the account's email,

so they can be better informed of the impact of their action.



This CL implements the corresponding behavior.

entry.title: Reland "Explicitly check when local time conversion fails."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 98888135cacb997022222b5493282f0ac8f8b94b.



Reason for revert: Roll forward with msan fix.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Explicitly check when local time conversion fails."

>

> This reverts commit 7e52434b1df6f7d13e20cdb7a0106aa72239f08a.

>

> Reason for revert: the new test is failing, and is likely causing other tests to fail as well.

>

> See:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/37593/test-results?sortby=&groupby=

>

> Sample failure:

>

> [ RUN ] TimeOfDayTest.ReturnsNullTimeWhenLocalTimeFails

> ==324697==WARNING: MemorySanitizer: use-of-uninitialized-value

> #0 0x5632f6dd4ee3 in base::Time::Exploded::HasValidValues() const ./../../base/time/time.cc:302:23

> #1 0x5632f61d489d in ash::TimeOfDay::ToTimeToday() const ./../../ash/system/time/time_of_day.cc:54:12

> #2 0x5632ea366c82 in ash::(anonymous namespace)::TimeOfDayTest_ReturnsNullTimeWhenLocalTimeFails_Test::TestBody() ./../../ash/system/time/time_of_day_unittest.cc:98:3

> #3 0x5632f496278c in HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest-internal-inl.h:0:10

> #4 0x5632f496278c in testing::Test::Run() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:2670:5

> #5 0x5632f49650b3 in testing::TestInfo::Run() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:2849:11

> #6 0x5632f4967144 in testing::TestSuite::Run() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:3008:30

> #7 0x5632f4994c10 in testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:5866:44

> #8 0x5632f4993ce2 in HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest-internal-inl.h:0:10

> #9 0x5632f4993ce2 in testing::UnitTest::Run() ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/src/gtest.cc:5440:10

> #10 0x5632f6f60f30 in RUN_ALL_TESTS ./../../third_party/googletest/src/googletest/include/gtest/gtest.h:2284:73

> #11 0x5632f6f60f30 in base::TestSuite::Run() ./../../base/test/test_suite.cc:461:16

> #12 0x5632f6f6c137 in Run ./../../base/functional/callback.h:152:12

> #13 0x5632f6f6c137 in RunTestSuite ./../../base/test/launcher/unit_test_launcher.cc:179:38

> #14 0x5632f6f6c137 in base::(anonymous namespace)::LaunchUnitTestsInternal(base::OnceCallback, unsigned long, int, unsigned long, bool, base::RepeatingCallback, base::OnceCallback) ./../../base/test/launcher/unit_test_launcher.cc:240:10

> #15 0x5632f6f6b824 in base::LaunchUnitTests(int, char**, base::OnceCallback, unsigned long) ./../../base/test/launcher/unit_test_launcher.cc:288:10

> #16 0x5632f68395ae in main ./../../ash/test/ash_unittests.cc:29:10

> #17 0x7f1f985cd082 in __libc_start_main ??:0:0

> #18 0x5632e637b029 in _start ??:0:0

>

> Uninitialized value was created by an allocation of 'now' in the stack frame

> #0 0x5632f61d4706 in ash::TimeOfDay::ToTimeToday() const ./../../ash/system/time/time_of_day.cc:48:3

>

>

> Other tests seem to be failing for the same reasons, e.g.

> ScheduledFeatureTest.HandlesLocalTimeFailuresSunsetToSunrise

>

> Original change's description:

> > Explicitly check when local time conversion fails.

> >

> > base::Time::LocalExplode() can fail. The API says to check

> > base::Time::Exploded::HasValidValues() to detect this.

> >

> > This functionally is probably the same as before because we

> > were passing the exploded output to base::Time::FromLocalExploded()

> > immediately after, and presumably, that would fail if the exploded

> > input had invalid values. But it's clearer to the reader if this

> > is explicitly checked first.

> > A unit test has also been added to TimeOfDay.

entry.title: Capture paint preview of all subframes in prerendered content
entry.content:
PaintPreviewClient gets stuck and never invokes completion callback

when it is run on prerendered pages with subframes.

http://www.chromestatus.com/metrics/css/timeline/popularity/4 is an

example of such a page. The reason is that paint preview is never

called for the subframes in prerendered content and therefore the

`awaiting_subframes` member of InProgressDocumentCaptureState never

gets empty. This causes the following if condition to always fail in

PaintPreviewClient::OnPaintPrewviewCaptureCallback and the completion

callback is never fired:



if (document_data->awaiting_subframes.empty())

OnFinished(params.document_guid, document_data);





The fix is to make NoStatePrefetchContents override

WebContentsDelegateImpl::CapturePaintPreviewOSubframe and ensure that

PaintPreviewClient is called for each subframe. This is similar to what

other delegates such as Browser::CapturePaintPreviewOfSubframe do when

paint preview is run on the same page when it is navigated to via the

address bar and is not prerendered. Here is the callstack for this

scenario:



Browser: :CapturePaintPreviewOfSubframe

content: :WebContentsImpl::CapturePaintPreviewOfCrossProcessSubframe

content: :RenderFrameProxyHost::CapturePaintPreviewOfCrossProcessSubframe

Change-Id: I748d9d62606160c64da86e4ad5c54347d96b54c1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4757283

Reviewed-by: Calder Kitagawa

Commit-Queue: Michael Tang

Reviewed-by: Ryan Sturm

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180997}

entry.title: Send line bounds through CursorAnchorInfo on requestCursorUpdate
entry.content:
The coordinates are calculated in Blink and ImeCompositionRangeChanged.

These coordinates are in the document coordinate space. They're sent

through Mojo and JNI to the CursorAnchorInfoController where the

current page's zoom and scroll offsets are applied to the coordinates.

After the transform, the new coordinates are attached to the CursorAnchorInfo object and sent to Android.

entry.title: Fix bug which auto enables BSM again after threshold has been crossed.
entry.content:
- When BSM is already active, and one of the thresholds get crossed,

the threshold variable doesn't get updated.



- This means if the user disables BSM at this threshold, BSM will get

re-enabled at the next available min/percent change which is a bad user

experience.



- Fixed an additional bug which prevents BSM from being re-enabled when the charger is plugged in, and then unplugged right away while still below either threshold.

entry.title: [Sync] Persist local_data_out_of_sync and fix deletion of metadata corresponding to the local session
entry.content:
This is a continuation of the work in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748603

which I'm taking over. Credit to mastiz@ for most of this change.



If sync metadata is deleted from storage, SessionStore will ignore the

tab upon browser restart. This is problematic on Android because

placeholder tabs rely on the information being restored from

SessionStore.



This CL changes the behavior of remote deletion of the local session

so that in addition to resubmitting the local session data the metadata

changes are also dropped. This prevents the deletion from SessionStore

so that placeholder tabs are retained and resubmitted.



Also move SyncingState.local_data_out_of_sync into SessionSyncPrefs to

persist across restarts. This avoids an issue where on a quick

restart this bit may be lost causing data to not be resubmitted and

fight back against the remote deletion.

entry.title: Cros network service sandbox: Unsandboxed if kerberos is enabled
entry.content:
The Linux/cros network service sandbox is incompatible with kerberos.

So, the network service will start unsandboxed if kerberos is

enabled, regardless of feature state or enterprise policy.



The KerberosEnabled enterprise policy can change at runtime. If it

flips to enabled, shut down the network service so it restarts

unsandboxed. This is not a sandbox hole because only admins

can enable kerberos.



Change-Id: I4ae1356f31c3f9182a0db803a2ee22ec7bd1744e

entry.title: Track analyzing content for scripted print preview
entry.content:
Printing entry points need to note when content analysis is happening,

otherwise print jobs can invoke system calls that happen when they

shouldn't. That can lead to system dialogs appearing when they are not

supposed to, and also to crashes.



Include tracking of this state for scripted print preview so that sites

that print using window.print() can succeed when content analysis is

used.



Fixed: 1464566

entry.title: [Passwords] Delete sync-ed entries if recently restored from backup
entry.content:
Analogous to crrev.com/c/4727928 (bookmarks) and crrev.com/c/4748239

(reading list), ported here for passwords.



The new logic is guarded behind feature flags (one of which is a

dedicated kill switch for passwords).



The design follows the very same principles (see description of the

patches linked above), and the implementation is essentially identical

to the one for reading list.



Specifically, ModelTypeSyncBridge::ApplyDisableSyncChanges() is

guaranteed to be invoked in all relevant cases. However, determining

whether the new behavior should be triggered requires careful guarding

during ModelReadyToSync().

entry.title: Add window.print() test coverage for Content Analysis
entry.content:
Update PrintBrowserTest helper functions to support starting Print

Preview with different invocation methods. This makes it easier to have

tests which might have different behavior if the printing is initiated

from the renderer instead of the browser.



Use the ability to initiate Print Preview with window.print() to add a

new content analysis test for scanning before Print Preview is

displayed.



This reveals problems for the configuration where out-of-process print

drivers is enabled for use with Content Analysis:

- An extra call to start a print job is made before analysis has

completed.

- A crash can occur during the printing of the job.



Bug: 1464566

entry.title: [SBv5] Connect StartHashRealTimeUrlCheck with URL checker
entry.content:
This CL enables hash-prefix real-time (HPRT) check on Android by passing

down the check request through SafeBrowsingUrlCheckImpl,

RemoteDatabaseManager and SafeBrowsingApiHandlerBridge. The enable

condition is the same as on desktop.



The main changes are:

* Add a new value kDatabaseManager in HashRealtimeSelection, and

set it on Android. Relevant tests on

DetermineHashRealTimeSelection are also updated.

* Add an additional parameter CheckBrowseUrlType in CheckBrowseUrl.

It is used to differentiate whether the check is for hash database

or hash real-time.

* Expand DatabaseManagerMechanism to support both hash database and

hash real-time check by taking in an additional check_type param.

* Split out HashRealTimeService::CanCheckUrl into

hash_realtime_utils helper namespace, so Android doesn't have

direct dependency on HashRealTimeService.

* Move the safe_browsing_url_checker_unittest target under

safe_browsing_mode != 0, so the tests are also run on Android.



This CL has not yet connected HPRT on WebView because

HashRealTimeSelection is still set to kNone[1].



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:android_webview/browser/aw_content_browser_client.cc;l=659;drc=39d7898be01c003ba2ac70b5ac7bac27a843a385;bpv=1;bpt=1

entry.title: [wpt-metadata] Ensure linter rule registry is updated
entry.content:
When linting WPT files in parallel on platforms that don't support

`multiprocessing`'s `fork` start method [1], the child processes will

not see updates to the rule registry, including one that disables

checking for `web-platform.test` in metadata files. Ensure that child

processes initialize their copies too, which also requires `BlinkTool`

to be pickleable.



[1]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/multiprocessing.html#contexts-and-start-methods

entry.title: Remove most GN config fields
entry.content:
When gnrt itself was formatting GN outputted, it had to be aware of

all GN-influencing config options. Now that a full-featured templating

language is used, gnrt_config.toml fields can instead simply be

exposed to the template. This way, the gnrt_config.toml and

BUILD.gn.hbs can be edited in conjunction to produce the desired

output, without changing gnrt internals.



A single extra_kv field is exposed overall and per-crate. Any

JSON-compatible value can be specified, and the handlebars template

can simply use that.



This is useful because gnrt does not need to be aware of the

domain-specific configuration, only what's common between all Cargo ->

build rule mappings. Further, it is a step towards exposing a somewhat

more abstract representation of the build rules to the templates,

which can further simply gnrt's implementation and move logic to the

templates, which are easier to understand.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Ia379138fe87bb8a6dfd459db7d7960076de9e324

CompositorFrameSinkSupport is destroyed.



https://crrev.com/c/4504986 we introduced {Add|Remove}SurfaceRanges API

to keep a current Surface referenced for copy, even after we have

navigated from the current page.



However, during a cross-proc navigation, we can have an edge case where

the GPU has received the COR but before the GPU can honor that COR.

The navigation destroys the old DelegatedFrameHost, thus destroying

the CompositorFrameSinkSupport for that FrameSinkId.



In such cases the surfaces are referenced but the CORs are forever lost,

thus we will never get the desired snapshot back.



This CL relocates those CORs made for specific SurfaceIds to the

corresponding Surfaces.



Bug: 1414172, 1465547

Low-Coverage-Reason: AW hardware_renderer.cc does not need new tests.

entry.title: [sticky] Keep marking for layout if we've propagated objects.
entry.content:
Now that we propagate LayoutObjects within the fragment tree - we could

encounter the situation where:

- A subtree becomes display-locked.

- An element is removed (which was propagated - like sticky).

- We re-use a fragment due to a cache hit (contains an invalid

layout-object).

- Update sticky-constraints == boom.



This patch keeps invalidating the layout-tree for display-locked roots

if we end up in this situtation (which should be sufficiently rare).



Fixed: 1470149

For the track-pad gesture improvements we need certain signals from the

MotionEvent that are only available on Android U+. Therefore we need to

ensure that devices running Android versions < Android U (34) do not run

the code that converts the track-pad MotionEvents to mouse events.



The code to do this was originally implemented in this CL -

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4355011.



Because we will be enabling the track-pad gesture improvements in M117,

this CL will need to be cherry-picked into that milestone.

entry.title: Check for non-zero selection bounds when showing touch selection menu.
entry.content:
Prevent the aura touch selection menu from appearing when the selection

bounds are zero, since this usually means that touch selection is not

active or that there is no cursor or selection. Currently in these

cases, a stray menu ends up incorrectly appearing at the top left of the

screen/app/content while the touch handles are not shown. Since the

touch handles weren't shown, the menu probably shouldn't have been shown

either.



Need to further investigate why the menu is being triggered in these

situations (seems that it is handling a long press context menu event

which it shouldn't handle), but for now just prevent the stray menu from

appearing. This is similar to how empty selection bounds are handled in

views so I think it should be ok:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/views/touchui/touch_selection_controller_impl.cc;l=739;drc=8f8154598d766545ee1e8234f93a895659f62434



(Also fix a test so that it waits for selection updates to occur before

checking whether the menu is shown, since this change means that the

menu won't be shown if no caret or selection has been set.)



Bug: 1470581, b:286348351

Change-Id: Ieae03fe5cd615ebc8c70b42382c6dcf28ca83f7c

entry.title: tracing: use default ShmemMode in creating the arbiter
entry.content:
This CL is a manual roll of perfetto with a fix in Chrome. The perfetto

upstream introduces the ShmemMode parameter in creating the

SharedMemoryArbiter in aosp/2627899 and causes breakage in tracing. Fix

by passing ShmemMode::kDefault (supporting cross-process Shmem) in

creating the arbiter. Also include a fix of perfetto unittest for

fuchsia (aosp/2696480).



This CL manually rolls perfetto from 446adf5b7bb4 to 8e8917c609bd

(36 revisions).

https://android.googlesource.com/platform/external/perfetto.git/+log/446adf5b7bb4..8e8917c609bd

entry.title: [Tracing w/SDK] Implement Start/Stop for memory_instrumentation
entry.content:
The "org.chromium.memory_instrumentation" datasource registered itself

in the SDK build, but did nothing. The memory instrumentation was

implemented as a TraceLog observer instead, which could create

problems in the presence of multiple simultaneous tracing sessions

(e.g. it would fail to start if another track_event session was

active).



This CL makes it a proper datasource that is configured independently

of track_event. It can now start/stop correctly in the presence of

multiple track_event sessions. Also memory dumps go only into those

sessions that have the datasource configured. It still doesn't support

multiple instances of itself though, so only one session can receive

memory dumps at a time.

entry.title: Commit Autocompletion when User presses physical <Tab> key.
entry.content:
The change permits key (alongside and keys) to

commit autocompletion in cases where autocompletion is available.



When eligible key is pressed, and autocompletion is available, the

logic consumes the key, and does not propagate it further. This is

done to suppress cases where there are multiple handlers for a given

key combination available - for example key is also used to move

focus to the next focusable item.



The eligible keys are only propagated if autocompletion is not

available, e.g. permitting key to move focus to the next Action

chip on selected suggestion, or permitting key to activate

suggestions.



The change also ensures the key properly activates

suggestions. Presently, we propagate only OnKeyDown events. The View

class arms an internal watch for a corresponding OnKeyUp event, and if

one is not offered, assumes a LongClick event, rather than regular

Click event.



Resolving this properly will take more time; until then, we will

capture and process keys by ourselves.



Change-Id: If331142e1d38d3b6cdfd7c216899b58d1cd0a0e6

Fixed: 1379810

entry.title: [@scope] Support selector filtering for :scope
entry.content:
This CL propagates the StyleScope (if any) to SelectorFilter, such that

we can "dereference" :scope selectors into their associated scoping

root selectors.



This optimization should be a good match for the default "mode" of

scoped selectors, since scoped selectors (in the normal case)

are prepended with an implicit descandant-combinated :scope selector:



@scope (.a) {

.b { ... } /* Equivalent to ":scope .b { ... }". */

}



AtScopeAncestor.html results, release build with DCHECK:



Without CL: avg 625 ms

With CL: avg 52 ms



The exact numbers above are not important, as long as there's a clear

difference between the two.



Bug: 1280240

Change-Id: Iad3e21a06c159b87e8e66e38fb713d53882190b5

entry.title: Cookie Controls: Reset Controls Controller info on new WebContents
entry.content:
Previously, when a new page was loaded, the CookieControlsController

reset information about what the initial page setting was.



This CL extends that, to also reset information when a new

WebContents is set, such as when a user changes tabs.



Extensive UI testing is included, as this was the simplest way to

invoke all the required interactions to elicit a failure without the

fix.

entry.title: [Android][3PPWM] Reflect options model changes in radio buttons
entry.content:
This CL introduces a custom component with two radio buttons.

The newly added ViewBinder maps the boolean model state of the pref

to the integer selection options represented by the radio buttons.

The selection of either button triggers the callback that updates

the pref.



Additionally, the Fragment adds help and feedback. It contains no

logic and is injected into the view directly and constant after

injection. Therefore, representing its state in the model is not

significant enough to justify the boilerplate.



Strings and mocks (linked in the bug) are far from being final.

Screenshots are at crbug.com/1469795#c4.

entry.title: media/gpu/vea_tests: Use default PSNR tolerance in scaling test case
entry.content:
The PSNR tolerance given by --psnr-threshold is ignored in the scaling

test case. It is because the PSNR threshold is for the original video

resolution, but the output resolution in the test case is 1/4 of the

input video resolution. Therefore, the PSNR value is reduced. Since

the appropriate PSNR tolerance is unknown, we use the default

tolerance in the test case.

entry.title: Fix a DCHECK with “will-change: contents” on partial MPC hits.
entry.content:
This was probably a long-standing issue that was only recently uncovered

with the added DCHECKs that things came out right after a partial MPC hit.

The issue is that we relied on setting will-change (which was marked as

noninherited) to set WillChangeContentsSubtree (which was marked as

inherited). So if we got a partial MPC hit, we would copy over all

noninherited properties from the MPC entry, and skip applying will-change.

But the inherited property WillChangeContentsSubtree would _not_ get

copied, and also, nothing would set it (it would stay at its initial

value of false, inherited from the parent), and thus, it would be the

wrong value.



We now do this pseudo-inheritance with yet another hack in StyleAdjuster

instead.



Bug: 1469858, 1470253, 1470406, 1470689
